events.message: The customer reported that their car was involved in a collision at a traffic light, causing damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an Auto Accident due to the involvement of the customer's vehicle in a collision incident.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to the case to ensure all aspects of the auto accident claim are handled promptly and thoroughly.
The claim has been officially acknowledged and the customer has been informed about the next steps in processing their auto accident claim.
The claims department requested the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates from the customer for further assessment.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police accident report, pictures of the damage, and two quotes from certified repair shops.
An investigation was initiated to verify the circumstances of the collision and to assess the extent of damages claimed by the customer.
The investigation team completed their review and confirmed the customer's report matches the evidence and supporting documents submitted.
A settlement proposal was prepared based on repair costs and policy coverage, with an offer sent to the customer for approval and acceptance.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement amount and the timely handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement offer.
The insurance payment was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover approved vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that repairs were completed successfully.
